Porkjet told me I need to have bones and he said that the animation for the panther is scaled, although i noticed certain parts of the panther (the nozzle opening and closing) do not change area (faces).

I figured he scaled them along the normals in blender, problem is, I can't get my head around that in bones! :c

Here's picture to show what I need:

Please help if you can.

Edited January 3, 2016 by strykersm

Try using two bones aligned and controlling with both the front and back faces, that would let you control the mesh the way you want. (there's no way to scale it by normals or by the Alt-S method in unity. It's just vanilla scale over in Unity.)

Just two other things; that mesh is pretty messy, and is pulling faces over the gaps. By pulling the mesh so far, there will be a lot of texture stretching on the end.
